channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-2143] Updated localized messages for Derby 10.2
item.description: Update the localized messages that were added during the 10.2 development cycle. Add new localizations for Czech, Hungarian, Polish, and Russian.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attaching a patch with updated translated messages for the current 9 languages, and introducing new translation for 4 new languages: Czech, Hungarian, Polish, and Russian. I intend to commit these new/changed files shortly, minus the Brazilian Portuguese changes, since Halley has already translated most of the error messages for pt_BR. Including the changes in the diff file here in case there is interest in reviewing the changes our translators made.

The patch looks good.
However, I do have a question re the Brazilian Portuguese files that you don't intend to commit...

I ran my little localization-check tool (which apparently doesn't work quite as well as I thought, it gave me some false failures about non-existing messages, and missed others), and compared the translated pt_BR files from your patch and found the following noteworthy differences between the current english, and current Brazilian, and I conclude that Halley's work has fallen behind a bit:

  • My recent change for DERBY-2110 (revision 479527) have not been implemented.
    I can easily do that after you've checked the other files in
  • No translations for the following messages:
    43Y58.U; 43Y59.U; 43Y60.U; 43Y61.U; J132; J133; XBCXNO.S; XBCXNP.S; XBCXNQ.S; XBCXNR.S; XBCXNS.S; XBCXNT.S; XBCXNU.U, XBCXV.U; XSDAN.S; 2200M; 2200V; 2200W; (42X46; 42X47); 42Z70-42Z79; XJ092.S; XML00; XML01; 0A000.S.7; 01J03; 01J09; 01J11; 01J14; I026; IJ_NoSuchTable; IJ_Rse0;
    In addition, there is no translation for parts of the ij_HelpText message:
  • SHOW SCHEMAS; SHOW TABLES; SHOW INDEXES; DESCRIBE
  • Following messages seem quite different:
    2200L; XJ086.S;
    and DBLOOK_Usage refers to jcc url instead of the Derby Client.
  • Following messages have different number of parameters:
    DRDA_Ready.I, DRDA_ShutdownSuccess.I
  • The following have been removed X0X14.S; X0X15.S; X0X16.S; X0X17.S; X0X18.S; X0XML.S.
    (changed to other numbers, looks like; X0X14 is now 42Z70, for example).

Halley - if you're following this discussion, do you intend to translate the missing messages / fix up the differences?

If not, I'll volunteer to patch the brazilian files up based on the translations above.

Finally, probably superfluous, I think adding new languages will cause test failures - at least in the derbynet/sysinfo* tests...The masters for those will have to get fixed up.

Thank you very much, Myrna, for identifying the descrepencies between the old and new Brazilian Portuguese messages. I've incorporated all of your suggestions. I'll leave it to Halley to review the new messages. Attaching a new patch which includes your suggestions.
Committed to 10.2 branch with revision 483352 and merged to trunk with revision 483356.

The changes includes these lines per file:

+# NLS_ENCODING=UTF-8
+# NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL

The UTF-8 concerns me, the defined format for properties files is ISO 8859-1 with unicode escapes.
That's what the changes look like but I just wanted to make sure that UTF-8 is not being used.

Myrna,

I'm following this discussion, but since I'm with many things to do this month I will not have time to translate the missing messages / fix up the differences in the next weeks.

I suppose that the absence of a message in the translated file only makes the message to be shown in English, nothing more, so it causes no harm, but if you volunteer to patch the Brazilian files up based on the translations above it will be good to me for it will give me more time to revise the files.
Doesn't look like the new languages have been added to the split targets.
Good catch, thanks Dan! Checked in a fix to split the new locales with revision 483596 for trunk and 483597 for 10.2 branch.

Thanks for all the heavy-lifting, Andrew! I have attached a change which updates the Supported Territories section of the Reference Guide:

1) Adds the new languages to the list

2) Alphabetizes the list since it's now impressively longer

If these look ok, I'd like to commit them to the trunk and to the 10.2 branch.
Looks good, Rick, thanks.

Adding a small patch that fixes up the areas I mentioned in a comment: testing/README.htm; tools/testing/reporting/TEMPLATES/testenv.sh and also adds the languages to the Network server Servlet.

If this looks good, I'll add it to trunk and 10.2

Also, I spotted 2 places in some other guides where the locales are referenced, I'm building a patch for that...
Committed derby-2143-refGuide-v01.diff to trunk at subversion revision 483656 and to 10.2 branch at subversion revision 483667.

3 files changed:
M src\tools\rtoolssysinfo1002629.dita
M src\pt_BR\getstart\rgslib46043.dita
M src\getstart\rgslib46043.dita

I modified some minor details in the sysinfo example as I was looking at it, including the revision number.

If this looks ok, I'll commit to trunk and 10.2 soon.
Both the doc and test patches you posted look good, Myrna. I didn't find any other references to the locale jar files in the docs. +1 to commit.
Committed: trunk src: 483696, 10.2 src: 483701, trunk docs: 483697; 10.2 docs 483699.
There is a syntax error (missing quote character) in NetServlet.java that prevents the trunk from compiling.

Attaching some - hopefully final - adjustments:
trunk & 10.2

  • tools/sysinfoMessages_fr.properties: doubling up necessary quotes
  • tools/toolsmessages_ru.properties: splitting up the DBLOOK_usage
    message so it wraps nicely
  • catch up on DERBY_2110 (and DERBY-1891) for all locales
    trunk:
  • reimplement some removals and changes, e.g. revision 482433.
    With 3 exceptions: I did not adjust error XJ125 for ja_JP, zh_CN, nor zh_TW.

If this looks good, I'll commit...

fixed up missing quote in NetServlet with revision 483820 on trunk and 483821 on 10.2
also (oops) slipped in sysinfoMessages_fr.properties on trunk.

Myrna,

New patches look fine, I noticed a couple of nit-picky issues, e.g. is the change to 40XD1 in German just a whitespace change? Noticed some other things like pre-Derby classnames in the message files, nothing that I would hold up committing the patch for, since these will be fixed whenever the next round of translation occurs from the XML-generated messages.

Thx for the review.
All this is pretty nit-picky anyway.
I had spotted 2 db2j references, is that what you refer to? Those are logged with DERBY-2156.

I diffed the diffs from 10.2 and trunk and found some anomalies:

  • Japanese had not had the messages removed in trunk and message 01J12 had somehow gotten attached to 01J11.
  • russian toolsmessages (DBLOOK reformatting) was missing from 10.2

So I redid the patches. I think it's pretty close now. I'll wait a bit, look at it again, then commit.

And yes, for many languages I removed some whitespace at the end of 40XD1. The whitespace was causing trouble when the string got inserted into message XBCXU and XBCXV - there would be a period, then some spaces, then another period. As I removed the periods from XBCXU & V I guess I could have left the trailing white space in, but it seemed to serve no purpose.
This was part of DERBY-2110 and most translators had faithfully copied the trailing whitespaces. I thought it clearer to remove it.

In case it wasn't clear from my previous message, the trunk message files do not have the following error messages because they're not in messages.xml:
XJ089; XJ092, 01J03; 01J09, 01J11. A number of files already had 01J03 removed in an earlier effort. And message XJ125 had been changed to refer to TYPE_SCROLL_INSENSITIVE only. Some of this was due to revision 442958; I assumed it just had not made it back to 10.2, so there was some minor divergence.

Note that now, also, the trunk patch no longer includes sysinfoMessages because I accidentally already committed it, but it was a correct and necessary change (to prevent the message showing things like "lenvironment" instead of "l'environnement").

I committed changes from patch DERBY_2143_2110_trunk.diff2 with revision 484671 and from patch DERBY_2143_2110_102.diff2 with revision 484676.

I believe this issue may now be closed.

iepnegativetests_ES was failing for j9_foundation in 10.2 and trunk because the master(canon) file ../functionTests/master/j9_foundation/iepnegativetests_ES.out was not updated with revisions 483356 (trunk) and 483352(10.2).
committed updated canons with revisions 486323 (10.2) and 486321 (trunk).
